result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan Antione Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bryan Antione Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci appeared by video for Bryan Antione Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  Defense counsel has been unable to meet with defendant and requests adjourned plea and sentencing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Bryan Antione Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Bryan Antione Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Pre-Trial Conference. Defense counsel informs court that the defendant has a pending felony matter. Parties request this case be set for a plea/sentencing hearing and that case 21CM3678 be accepted from Br 1 for global resolution. Court does not object. Case adjourned for a plea/sentencing hearing to Br 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Filings Due scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Bryan Antione Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Bryan Antione Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  State advises Court of possible global offer.  Court will set case to adjourned pretrial conference for parties to discuss possible resolution.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with TSC
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Bryan Antione Johnson in court with Attorney Alexander Kostal.  Defendant Bryan Antoine Johnson in custody.  Nate McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bryan Antione Johnson appeared by video means with attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Pre-trial Conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
